name: cyclohexanol, 4-chloro-, trans-
Reason: The compound cyclohexanol, 4-chloro-, trans- has a melting point that can be predicted by considering the functional groups present in the molecule. The cyclohexane ring itself has a melting point of around 5.5°C. The chlorine atom attached to the ring can increase the melting point due to increased polarity and intermolecular interactions, estimated to contribute +50°C. The presence of a trans configuration can also contribute to a higher melting point due to increased steric hindrance and planarity, estimated to contribute +20°C.
